column5: Spent the week of 6/7 - 6/14 on Big Vermilion Lake at River Edge Outfitters. Cam and Anne run a great camp. Great people!! Cabins, docks & grounds are first class. We love fishing for smallies and Big V did not disappoint. We had planned to also fish on Lost Lake but never made it over there. Even though the water was still a little chilly we managed to catch quite a few fish on topwater. I spend the winter months making top water balsa baits and the smallmouth loved them. A little extra added satisfaction catching these guys on your own baits. I know we had to catch close to 600 bass for the week. We did one shore lunch and had a hard time catching 4 fish small enough to keep. Everything else was released. It's a long trip from Ohio but we already booked for next year and can't wait. Eagles flying, loons singing and fish biting. You just can't beat a Canadian fishing trip!!
Here are a few of the topwater baits I made that the smallies just loved to bust. We also landed some pike on them. Tough on 6# mono.
Yeah, I gotta agree with Bakefish. Those plugs are top shelf for sure. They belong in the the Walleye Central Home Grown Tackle "Wall of Fame". Well done Buckeye Bill!

Those are slick. I wish I had the patience and talent to make something like those, but I have neither. I'm sure there is a lot of extra gratification in enticing a bass to hit your hand-made artwork.
